website_summaries.verdict: Plenty of power for some serious breaking. Basic "old-school" tool that doesn't have the user-friendly features of some, but it gets the job done.
pros: Performance is on a par with much more expensive machines
cons: As with many budget models, oil leaks are not uncommon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product- don’t honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price means cheap product! This broke on me in less than six months of normal use. Purchased an extended warranty that this company wouldn’t honor. Blamed me for mis use which was not true! Purchased (3) spade shovel bits and every one cracked in half in less than 30 days!!! So unhappy with this product and their customer service is horrible they do not stand behind their product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!  10" concrete was no match for this hammer.
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised how well this works! The pin, chisel & shovel attachments will make your life easier. READ the directions and fill with lube BEFORE using. If your a pro and need one to occasionally break up a floor or sidewalk or even a nut like me who had to remove 10" thick 8x12 slab, you'll love the value. If you need one for a few days the rental cost will probably be more than purchasing this. Buy it! Also, digging holes in South Carolina clay is no fun. This makes it easy with the shovel attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: Had to break up some concrete for a remodel I was doing on my home. I checked the cost of renting plus the time it would take to accomplish the job and it just made sense to purchase my own. Yes this jackhammers made in china but I found it very durable and the quality is top notch. This hammer worked great and did the job. Glad I got it. Note: I used a little light grease on the bits where it inserts on the hammer, it seems to help with changing bits and allowing them to move more freely when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: As weak armed as I am. I could use this to break up the concrete to put post for fence. It wasnt light, but light enough for me to use. It worked well. And it got a lot of use. Got wet from the rain and didn’t have a problem Cons: electric bill was about 150$ more during Both the month that we used it
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Raines

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jack hammer to break 60 pound blocks of concrete that had been placed around old fence posts. In the past, I had used an iron rod and manually would break the concrete around these old posts. My back would hurt for days afterwards. This jack hammer made the job extremely easy and simple. I would definitely recommend it. However, beware that it is a bit on the heavy side (about 35 - 40 pounds). Also, the key is to simply let the weight of the device do the work (i.e. do not try to press downward on it when it is running). I was able to break each block in about 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: K. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: Got almost 6 months use before it simply stopped working. The carbon brushes were fine. Think maybe the motor burned out. First it was erratic, then it just stopped. Glad the warrantee is still good, but I am right in the middle of a project, so this means more delays. June 2017 The company paid for me to send it back to them and very quickly sent me a new one at their expense. Not sure if that is company policy, or Amazon Prime policy, but either way I am now a happy camper. The replacement worked fine and I (actually my husband) finished the project :) Rating goes form one star to four.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C. Moyer

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE -- bit compatibility
customer_reviews.text: This is the corporate deflection I received from TR Industrial from an inquiry regarding bit compatibility. They clearly do not care much about their customers nor bit compatibility with other manufactures such as Bosch, Hitachi, Makita et al.. ".....We have not tested other brand bits on the jack hammers and can not guarantee if the other brand bits will work for the jack hammer....."
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I was worried it wasn't going to be big enough/heavy enough for my task. But it broke up the concrete steps with no issues. Well worth the money. Yes it will leak some oil, but it's not much. Easy to check the oil level using the sight on the side of the unit. It's not the cheapest option on Amazon, but based on the reviews of other units, it seems like the best value.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Why RENT when you can BUY!
customer_reviews.text: With breaker rental at $72/day or $288/week, I decided to buy this for a backyard landscape project install in Las Vegas. I had some concerns given the lower price, but this is a rock solid, heavy duty, easy to use breaker that made digging holes and turning beds in rock hard and caliche laced soil a breeze. Used it for about two months with absolutely no issues. Comes with the hard case, gloves, 15ft cord, two bits, bit oil and spare brushes. Addition bits and accessories are available. This was the best investment I've made on any DIY project! BTW - neighbors are glad the project is complete - it does make some noise and hearing protection is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Masson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This thing works good! I bought this along with the spade bit to help break up dirt. I am a service plumber and need to get to pipes under ground or under concrete, this things breaks up concrete very well. It's been a couple years now and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool. Used for about 5 minutes and it just started humming and not jack hammering anymore. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: OP-Dave

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse of a tool.
customer_reviews.text: Broke through multiple 24" deep post pillars and still going. Would happily buy it again in the future if were to ever break. For the money, it makes the orange store rental fees seem absurd.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool because it is very powerful and durable. This tool is especially awesome for the price. Yes this tool is made in China, but the quality is not cheap in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: westun harvey

customer_reviews.title: Extension of Shaft
customer_reviews.text: Jackhammer work fine & continuous for 8 hrs. I brought an Asphalt Cutter Chisel and tR89102 Clay Spade. The only problem I have is that it work perfectly on hard surface but when it hit loose dirt or hard clay the hammer refuse to work. I had was to raise it off the ground and hit it on the clay soil for it to operate. The next day I have decided to add a piece of 3/4” x 3/4” round steel in the shaft to get it to work perfectly. Other wise it’s worth the price
customer_reviews.author: patrick yung

customer_reviews.title: This is a steal.  No lie.
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations hugely. The demo you see in the picture was just a few minutes worth. Thank you TR Industrial, for the tool, accessories and the awesomeness. As soon as this thing started up for the first time I laughed out loud because I knew this was perfect for the job. 5 STARS - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: D.Warren.J.K.

customer_reviews.title: No luck with this......
customer_reviews.text: This is the second go around for this item. Seems to work once in a while very well, then goes into a vibrate mode that doesnt 'jackhammer'. I will try something different, as this item clearly has some bugs
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive jack hammer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it and used it to break up some concrete. I was really surprised on how well it worked. It broke up my concrete really easy. Well worth the money. It didnt use that much oil either. Great jack hammer.
customer_reviews.author: N. Piazza

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to help dig some holes to plant some trees. I live right next to a quarry so my soil is literally just rock and clay. This thing is a beast! Cut through the rock like butter. Totally worth it for the price, especially if you're going to rent one for 100 bucks a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a good price point
customer_reviews.text: This Paving breaker will break up concrete, asphalt, clay - you name it. Keep it oiled and know that it will be messy taking the chisels in and out. Not the heaviest Duty but great for do-it-yourself oriented homeowners
customer_reviews.author: Ironboy70

customer_reviews.title: jack hammer.
customer_reviews.text: tore up sidewalk on pool, was surprised how well it was made for price, way better than a sledge hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: All i can say about this is go buy it great investment. Will pay for it self ten times over if your in the concrete business like my self. just buy the oil and back up tips, but i will say some times you have to reengage the hammer. basically you have to push down on it some time but this thing goes crazy on concrete with wier mesh or with out. i use it for hours and hours no complaints. 4in slab or 6in slab
customer_reviews.author: BeshearsAnytimeLLC

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: For the great price, I thought this unit would be cheaply made, but it's tough. I bought a second one and that about says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use during a Mission Trip in Kenya. Our team built a Dam in a river and we used the tool to break bed rock and also to drive steel re-bar deep into the ground using a special head made to do so. The tool worked great and was a huge timesaver. I chose this model because it only weighed 47lbs including the case which allowed me to check it as a piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: lynesa jamison

customer_reviews.title: Dang
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a large stone and cement planter. Powerful, effective, and cheap. It cost me less to but this than a rental for the one job over 3 weekends. I wish I would have purchased prior to planting some trees around the property, as I live on land made almost entirely consisting of rock and clay.
customer_reviews.author: Stevem

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for concrete demolition
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit, solidly built. Used it to remove part of a concrete slab prior to installing a sump pump. Was finished in less than a half hour. Came very complete with multiple bits, goggles, gloves and oil, plus a nice carrying case with wheels. For the price of a few days rental, I now own this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J. Davieau

customer_reviews.title: You’ll have neighbors asking to borrow it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the ridiculous hard pan I have around my house. Using it to plant plants, fix fence posts etc. bought a spade tip. Couldn’t be happier. All the neighbors wand to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but sometimes stops hammering
customer_reviews.text: I’m an electrician and this works pretty well for the cost. I have used it for many ground rods and it does pretty well. Unfortunately it stops the hammer function occasionally. I need to turn it off then back on and bounce it up and down a few times to get it to unjar. For the cost I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alive Electric

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great ... I used it to take down a retaining wall. Watch the YouTube video posted by the Texan ... good product review ... make sure you get yourself oil + grease ... very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Becareful tool has issues
customer_reviews.text: Having trouble with jack hammer staying engeged & trying to get it to start jack hammering
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works really well.
customer_reviews.text: This is the more powerful model and it does a good job. Use a good 12ga 50 foot extension cord. First project was the removal of 14 yds of reinforced concrete on the side of the house. No problems,did not experience loose screws or oil leaks. Only suggestion is to put some oil/grease on the drive end of the bits when installing, to cut down on any friction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Heck yeah I bought this one over DeWalt. I saved over $1,000. And this one works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Joiner

customer_reviews.title: Can you say POWERFULL!!
customer_reviews.text: I only wish I needed to use it daily, it get the job done easily. Very capable tool but small oil leak is annoying
customer_reviews.author: T. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, cement all around begins to get scared ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, cement all around begins to get scared when I open the case of this animal, I busted a 6” trench 37’ In a little over an hour did a good job would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tim K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great value, slices through concrete sidewalk. Hardest part was installing the bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Price is right.
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well for us on concrete demolition, as well as for busing up compacted gravel. My only complaint is that the electrical cable plug came bent. However, it straightened back out by hand and still seemed to work as it should. Hopefully it holds up for years. Can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Resa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great, better than renting one out, highly recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after many months
customer_reviews.text: Still working great after many months. I am just a home owner, not a contractor, but it has done the job when needed. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Randazzo

customer_reviews.title: Now that's great customer service
customer_reviews.text: it broke after 3 months of use. WOW...received an email from TR to return my jackhammer. They replaced it without question. Now that's great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Rich L

customer_reviews.title: We bought it for our hard as rock caliche in ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for our hard as rock caliche in our backyard (Phoenix Arizona area) and it pounds right through it and makes digging holes/excavation so much easier! No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very good jack hammer!
customer_reviews.text: The jack hammer is very solid and easy to handle. I used it to break the concrete floor in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy any other hammer!
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is better than the rentals! It is powerful and well made. The customer support is here in the US and the company is serious about supporting their products.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product works
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than renting if you need for a few projects. I've used on 3 different demos and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Electric Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Jack hammer works great when I got it. I do an update after several light jobs and a moderate one.
customer_reviews.author: Randy,

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I'm adding a basement bathroom and need to breakhp the concrete slab to add the drainlines. It worked perfectly! Plumber quoted $1000 to do it. Saved a bundle doing it myself!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this thing was terrible. The jackhammer part didn't jack
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing was terrible. The jackhammer part didn't jack, or hammer. It just vibrated. I bought this to dig holes for planting in AZ, very hard ground. It doesn't work. When I read the trouble shooting guide it states (not exact words) "if you are hammering in soil it will only vibrate, this is normal ops"...what???? I bought a jack hammer for the purpose of a jack hammer, if I wanted a vibrator I'd go elsewhere. Used it for 10 minutes, kept on trying, it would hammer for a second or 2 then vibrate. I will say that when the hammer did actually engage, it worked fantastic. So very disappointed in this. Will shop for another.
customer_reviews.author: NealZ

customer_reviews.title: The bits look like new after 8 hours of heavy rock splitting.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic jack hammer, broke up some large granite rocks in our driveway even better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Salli

customer_reviews.title: ... tool would be because of low price worked flawless better than rented tools definitely Best buy
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how this tool would be because of low price worked flawless better than rented tools definitely Best buy
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Buy a makita instead
customer_reviews.text: Save some money and buy a makita. Works good intermittently seems like the bits jam drives me crazy you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Heather P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just used it again and it is impressive. the workers want one now.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Dick

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: This machine is easy to use and works really well. Used to tear through concrete and break up some very large boulders in my yard
customer_reviews.author: David O'Berry

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning with light duty use..
customer_reviews.text: Worked for two week period and now oil spills each and everytime it is on... also sticks from time to time...
customer_reviews.author: Hugh O.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works like any name brand. Worth the money for sure.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: but what I hated most was during my first project use—-the handle bolt ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the machine was ok, but what I hated most was during my first project use—-the handle bolt came off and I still don’t know how to fix it to get a better grip.
customer_reviews.author: Elwin Quitano

customer_reviews.title: Good tool .
customer_reviews.text: My first buy did not got the tool on mail. Got lost . The second buy got it on time. I have couple of days using it and sems is doing ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jose H Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good concept. Not good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good price but super unreliable. 1. Broke after a few uses 2. Even when it did work, it would get stuck 3. Its heavy 4. The case is not well designed to repackage when done using Buy a Dewalt or Makita or rent one if you don't have the money. This product is not ready for the limelight yet. The professional brands have the engineering revisions over the years behind them that make them worth it. This is a first edition that is just not that great or reliable. You think you're getting a good deal for the price but you're just going to be out more money for time wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: little heavy tan I like but does a good job , that's what count
customer_reviews.author: roach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value at a good price. Very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Woinarowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great Jackhamer
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Was leery as a contractor but it works great. We will see long term but for now I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: michael rider

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper and more convenient to purchase this tool than rent one for my drain tile project. Busted through 30 feet of 4 inch thick concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Parkerhigh1

customer_reviews.title: Works great....
customer_reviews.text: Works great... Made easy work out of a egress window and new bath in basement....
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Romero

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great tool... does what I needed it to do for hundreds less than the more expensive versions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on makita or hitachi
customer_reviews.text: Bit continues to jam, therefore won’t hammer. Very poor product. Spend the money and get a hitachi or makita’
customer_reviews.author: Jan E. Nassar

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected and did a very nice job on the project it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: So far, this tool does exactly what it is ...
customer_reviews.text: So far , this tool does exactly what it is suppose to do. I will update as necessary
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a home owner who doesn't want to rent ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for a home owner who doesn't want to rent a larger hammer for a short time. Easy to handle and work great for my needs. Not a large unit for breakig up roads.
customer_reviews.author: RMreview

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is amazing!!! I was needing to dig some holes at our mountain home for footers to set the legs on for a deck I'm building.The ground is solid rock and I needed a depth of 24". I was able to dig each hole 10" diameter and the 24" depth in about an hours time. It is heavy enough not break rock yet easily handled in a deep hole to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rob T.

customer_reviews.title: Even usable for an old guy, saved my back ...
customer_reviews.text: Even usable for an old guy, saved my back from swinging a sledge. Just wish the company offered a wide 10"-12" scraper blade for thin-set removal!
customer_reviews.author: The West

customer_reviews.title: works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: they claim that this unit weights about 35 pounds which is not true, the actual product is heavier, works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ender davila

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Carrying case wheel broken off on the second day other then that Great product super fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: dariel green

customer_reviews.title: This is one good demolition hammer kit! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a kick-ass demolition hammer. I used it for digging trenches, busting up rock and concrete, and tamping down reburied trenches.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my garage
customer_reviews.text: Great tool a must have for anyone that would rent one more then once! Absolutely best purchase I’ve made in awhile!,
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Turner

product_meta.title: TR Industrial TR89305 Electric Jack Hammer for Demolition, 60-Joules, ETL Listed
product_meta.description: The all new TR-300 series jackhammer by TR Industrial brings you more power and speed. The demolition hammer delivers an exceptional 60 Joules (44.2 ft-lbs) of impact energy while weights only 35 lbs (published weight on jackhammer only, not including the weight of chisel and extended power cord). Its high-strength modulus gear delivers longer life. With all metal housing and barrel, this jackhammer is built for heavy-duty applications. With unparalleled 1800 BPM (blows-per-minute), the ultra fast demolition helps your get the job done faster. For your safety and convenience, we have made an extra long 20-ft UL listed power cord with double insulated plug that comes with the demolition hammer - no more need for extension cords. The TR Industrial TR-300 Demolition Jack Hammer bears an ETL Listed Mark - it has been independently and rigorously tested to comply with UL safety standards. The demolition jack hammer comes standard with (1) bull-point and (1) flat chisel, a pair of premium tough work-gloves and a custom fitting molded case with wheels for easy transport. TR Industrial also offers other accessories for the TR-300 series demolition hammer for your need, additional accessories sold separately.
feature_bullets: 60 joules (44.2 ft-lbs) of impact energy delivers powerful, maximum performance
1800 BPM ultra fast demolition helps you get the job done faster
All-metal housing built for heavy-duty applications
20-ft extra long UL listed power cord with double insulated plug, handles extreme-weather
ETL Listed, rigorously tested and certified to comply with UL safety standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars163 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
